terrapeer.vui.j3dui.control.actuators
Interface ActuationTarget

All Known Subinterfaces:
PseudoActuator
All Known Implementing Classes:
ActuationSplitter, Actuator, OrbitGroup, RotationSphereGroup
public interface ActuationTarget

This interface serves as a target for input actuation events. Actuations can occur with a fixed or cumulative offset. Depending on the actuation involved, not all of the dimensions in the actuation value may be used (the value could be 1D, 2D, 3D, or 4D), and values may be interpreted in different coordinates spaces (translation, rotation, scale, color, etc.).

Method Summary
 void initActuation(javax.vecmath.Tuple4d value)
          Initializes the actuation reference value and target object actuation state to the specified value.
 void syncActuation()
          Synchronizes the actuation reference value with the current target object actuation state.
 void updateActuation(javax.vecmath.Tuple4d value)
          Updates the target object actuation state to the specified value relative to the actuation reference value.
 

Method Detail

initActuation

public void initActuation(javax.vecmath.Tuple4d value)
Initializes the actuation reference value and target object actuation state to the specified value. The default reference value is specific to the target.

Parameters:
value - Actuation reference value.

updateActuation

public void updateActuation(javax.vecmath.Tuple4d value)
Updates the target object actuation state to the specified value relative to the actuation reference value. The manner in which the new value is applied to the reference (additive, logarithmic, etc.) is specific to the target.

Parameters:
value - Actuation update value.

syncActuation

public void syncActuation()
Synchronizes the actuation reference value with the current target object actuation state. Typically called at the end of a drag operation so that the actuation offset will be cumulative.
